thread.title: Enyimba, Wolves, Sunshine Fire Up Glo Premier League Race
thread.title_full: Enyimba, Wolves, Sunshine Fire Up Glo Premier League Race

author: Prince Imehiron
title: Enyimba, Wolves, Sunshine Fire Up Glo Premier League Race
text:
Headlines / Enyimba, Wolves, Sunshine Fire Up Glo Premier League Race Enyimba, Wolves, Sunshine Fire Up Glo Premier League Race 
Completesportsnigeria.com's ADEBOYE AMOSU examines the chances of the leading contenders as the Glo Premier League campaign heads towards an exciting climaxâ€¦ 

ENYIMBA 
Few weeks ago, the Glo Premier League title seemed to be heading to Aba, but the Peoples Elephant's 2-1 defeat against Oriental rivals, Heartland, has changed all the permutations. 
Enyimba now enjoy a slender three point advantage over their closest challengers, Warri Wolves, who leapt to the second position following a comfortable 3-0 home win against Sunshine Stars last weekend. 
With six games left to play, three at home and three on the road, supporters of the former African champions will be keen to see their side hold on to their slim advantage. 
Coach Kadiri Ikhana will be worried by the side's poor away form in recent weeks even though they possess the best away record in the league this season, having garnered 19 points on their travels. 
The Aba-based outfit have lost their last three away games against El-Kanemi Warriors, Giwa FC and Heartland. They alongside Wikki Tourists are the only teams among the four vying for the title yet to lose at home, but they have dropped points four times. 
With crucial away fixtures against local rivals, Abia Warriors, who they are yet to beat in a competitive outing, and a visit to Sunshine Stars still on the cards, Ikhana's men will have to do it the hard way if they are to lift a record seventh title. 
REMAINING FIXTURES
